name: Mercure Brighton Seafront Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our short break in Brighton was a milestone birthday treat for my wife. And it certainly was a treat.
reviews.title: Revival of a great Victorian lady

reviews.text: The Mercure is an old Victorian hotel (formerly the Norfolk) which has been taken over by Mercure and is being progressively modernised and upgraded. We had a traditional, spacious seafront room: high ceilings with original or restored plasterwork, comfortable bed and chairs, big bathroom. All spotlessly clean. The bar includes an air-conditioned sun lounge – ideal for a few cooling drinks in the middle of a heatwave.
reviews.title: 2nd theft in room.

reviews.text: Very helpful staff, both on arrival and during our stay – although there was only one receptionist working when we checked out; she was hard-pressed to deal with a line of customers and a string of phone calls – but maintained her charm and composure. Just what we expect from an Accor group hotel.
reviews.title: Loyalty status or not: Never again!
Theft in the room
reviews.text: The only negative – as so often at all levels and types of hotel in the UK – was breakfast. Do hotel schools and training programmes teach managers to downgrade food and service standards at breakfast?

Shabby, tired hotel with very poor customer service. Chose this hotel as it was one of the only seafront hotels which seemed to offer parking facilities. Small print however states that £15.00 per day will be charged for this '1st come, 1st serve' privilege. Have cancelled both future bookings made through my Company and will stay elsewhere. When I complained, I was told that it is not their responsibility as they had stated it 'somewhere' on their website!
reviews.title: Very poor customer service

reviews.text: Despite paying in full in advance, check in took 20 minutes - painfully slow. Shabby chic interiors didn't bother us but then we got our room! So small you could just about squeeze around the double bed, no air con, no windows so was basically an airless box! Floors so creaky we woke up when our upstairs neighbour visited the loo in the night. Manager just shrugged her shoulders when we complained. Only barman was friendly and was quick and efficient. This experience has put us off Mercure hotels completely
reviews.title: Possibly the worst hotel room I've ever had

reviews.text: Stayed last night for wedding anniversary. Room (258) was clean, spacious and had a small balcony. Good sized bathroom and comfy bed. Plenty of towels and reasonable tea facilities. Out for a meal elsewhere (planned it that way) and back for drinks at the bar. Again comfortable and restful area to chat and end the day. Breakfast was well stocked with full English & continental options, plenty of juices and cereals. Despite a fire alarm going off (which was well run and safely completed) our stay was hassle free and extremely pleasant. The staff were helpful and accommodating. We loved it. We will be back. Thanks so much!! Xxxxx
reviews.title: Marvellous!

reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend in late June. Hotel is very tired and in need of updating and modernisation. Carpets are worn out etc and general first impressions were really quite naff. But I suppose for the money etc and location I shouldn't have expected too much. Had I bothered to pay fifty quid more, I could have stayed at the grand hotel further up the road.
reviews.title: Average & perfunctory but clean.

reviews.text: The rooms were clean but in need of updating. I imagine they are currently making far too much money from the constant stream of stag and hen dos to warrant a refurb.
reviews.title: Dreadful, awful, terrible

reviews.text: The staff are very helpful, and early booking gave us an excellent price, I remember the hotel as the Norfolk as Brighton was my home town 45 years ago.
reviews.title: Good position
Absolute shambles!!
reviews.text: The rooms I believe are from that era they need a serious upgrade but for 1 night wasn't the end of the world.
I'd like to say I'd be back, and if they improved the rooms & put in air conditioning I will go back in a flash, but as it is will,look for another good priced deal.
reviews.title: Terrible hotel - in dire need of renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had booked two double rooms, for one night. Only upon arrival, did the receptionist inform us that if we wanted to park our car in the hotel car-park that we had to pay a £15 per night fee. This however did not guarantee our place in the car-park and so elected to keep the car there in-case we couldn't find a space on return and had to pay high priced on-road parking.
reviews.title: Very disappointing
smallest "4star" room ever , poor condition.
reviews.text: we booked this hotel room on the basis that it was a "4 star seafront hotel " via lastminute.com and we knew that having got a discount we wouldn't get a suite but this room was probably the smallest and poorest quality we had ever seen .
the furniture was old and frayed, the decoration faded and the view from the window was a decomposing seagull ( been there for very long time ) on the ledge just below. see pictures .
reviews.title: Could have been so good...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it was an unusually hot night so we thought a 4star hotel would have air con but no we had a fan that did not work properly , the window only opened about 2 inches .
reviews.title: Nigth Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: luckily we were only staying one night so at checkout, when we were asked about the quality of our stay, we told the receptionist about the shortfalls , she said that we should have told them earlier .
reviews.title: Great stay and what nice people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in my opinion this was a " discount " room that had no right to be called 4star and we were told this was one of the better rooms from the receptionist !
reviews.title: Not as terrible as reviews made out!

description: Location doesn’t come much better than this, right on Brighton seafront with fantastic views of the beach and out to sea. Close to the Brighton Centre and the town centre this elegant Regency style hotel is perfectly situated for business and leisure guests.Each of the 123 bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom, flat screen LCD TV featuring in room entertainment and high-speed internet access, hairdryer, trouser press as well as tea and coffee making facilities.
